reviews.author: Power Ck
reviews.title: å””çŸ¥HUMAè®€å’©å¥½, åˆæœ‰å­¸ééŸ³æ¨‚å˜…å°±å ±å•¦, åæ­£CCéƒ½å””æœƒå¤ªå¥½grade(?)
reviews.comment_content: Easy stuff, all about simple theories in ABRSM syllabus. You need to buy a book (either e-book or printed) for assignment. For course details, see attachment.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Kaila:

I think Kaila is an excellent and experienced professor, with (comparatively) clearer English speaking, I can almost understand what he meant in lectures.

Some flaws. Kaila won't write down some key terms that are needed to understand.

He is very kind that likely to answer your question.

Galison Lau:

In the tutorials, he explained many mistakes that found in our assignments, and try to illustrate to us what is the correct one.

The main part of the tutorial is ear training. I think he did not show us the skills, only doing some exercises...

He is also likely to answer your question.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments:

After every lecture, Kalia will give us some assignments to do and we need to hand them in before the next lecture start. But all of the assignments all extremely easy, but annoying (some kind of too much).

Midterm and Final:

1 MT and 1 Final. Extremely easy, what you need to do is be careful with careless mistakes.

Composition Project:

Not hard, spend a few hours can finish a composition with chords. And, in assignments, some of them are guidelines to this projects. Kalia will give you comments in details. It is extremely great.

Concert Report:

We are required to attend 2 concerts, and choose one piece of music in one of the concert to write about. NO any example provided and I did not get any ideas about it. (Maybe my English are very bad.)

Attendence:

No problem, just press 'yes' in iPRS.
_________

By the way, I have no idea that why they did not give us any results or feedbacks about the final, project and report. THEY RELEASE THE GRADE DIRECTLY!!!!!!! I do not think it is acceptable.
reviews.comment_workload:
As I said, many annoying assignments, but very easy, so take it easy.

For concert weeks, no lectures and tutorials, great.

I feel sucks in the ear training part, not very useful in this part, I just ignore it, smirk.

reviews.author: nkk
reviews.comment_content:
Basic music theory, focusing on reading, writing and analytical listening.

Main focus:
Writing skills: major and minor keys, intervals, chords, chord progressions and simple harmonic analysis
Aural skills:
recognizing chords and intervals, notating simple melodies and rhythms by ear, distinguishing major and minor, meters and textures

The first half of the course (before midterm) is easier for those who have music theory grade 5.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Average.
Using the textbook to assist your revision after lectures will be helpful in case you can't catch up with what the lecturer says.
Tutorials are not too helpful though its aim is to train and consolidate your aural skills because not many practical and useful techniques are taught.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term is easy to score high if you are familiar with the content and practise well, but time management is also important because only around 50 mins are given to complete the exam, which might be too short if you are not skilful enough.
Final exam focuses more on aural skills, which require more practice, it would be better to study well for the reading and writing parts if you are not confident of doing well in the aural part.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy.
Average 3-4 homework assignments to be finished after each lecture.
Class attendance (for both lecture and tutorial) is very important while arriving late twice will be counted as being absent once, which is quite demanding.
One concert report and one composition exercise to be submitted at the end of the course.

reviews.author: uo3626
reviews.title: Good for music lover
reviews.comment_content: People say that this course is dominated by people who have music background. I also have taken music theory exam level 5 in the past. I have knowledge of everything taught in the first half of the course. But the second half exceeds music theory exam level 5 and can become a bit difficult sometimes. Homework and exam are quite easy so losing 1 or 2 marks can really downgrade your course grade. But overall, for me, I feel the course curriculum is well designed for people who want to learn music and is very useful. You get to learn from scratch, learn music composition, and build up pretty good foundation.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer is solemn for most of the times and do not allow people chat during the lecture. He will pick you to answer question if you do not pay attention. Also, attendance is taken for every lesson and tutorial. The tutor can remember everybody's face. It sounds pretty horrible but I found it not really harsh if you want to learn seriously.
reviews.comment_grading: I got A- with quite a lot of mistakes in my homework but almost full marks in midterm and final exam. Actually you can easily get source for homework so I think it's not hard to get A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework every week. Attendance taken every lecture and tutorial within the first minute of lecture with your PRS. But homework is not difficult, exam is easy too.

reviews.author: Denise Tse
reviews.title: Don't take this course if you have no music theory background
reviews.comment_content: You know all content before midterm if you know grade 5 music theory. Content after midterm is a little bit difficult. They require you to be able to know the chord when the instructor plays it, and do melody dictation, though not difficult in fact.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nothing special. Not very interesting but not boring. Quite easy to understand if you have attended the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not as good as my expectation. I got 93/100 in ABRSM grade 5 music theory exam, and 103/104 in midterm exam, but it turns out an A- in this course. Score of essay is not known.

Well...not bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Very high workload. There are assignments almost every lecture, 1 final project (composing your own piece), and 1 concert report. Requires attendance for every lecture and no exclusion, i.e., if you cannot take a sick leave even if you are sick

reviews.author: Fransis C
reviews.comment_content:
Content is very simple. If you practice enough you can get good grade easily.
Four lunch talks and two concerts are compulsory, but well... they are pretty lame, few good compositions.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, I don't find the teaching helpful. But Prof is a fun guy. Use teoria, cuz music theory is about practicing :) There's raffling in class, so.. if you wish to use iprs set to take attendance, find someone to answer questions for you or you'll have one absence.
reviews.comment_grading: Well grading is okay la. I got a fever in midterm and screwed that up with below mean 0.5sd grade, still managed to get B+, cuz I think I did well in final and my concert report. Full mark in attendance, maybe 95% in assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty huge. Assignments must be handed in every class, and the final composition nearly killed me. I hate composing in a short time. You also have to write a concert report, well... it wasn't as easy as I expected. Unless you're an expert or really an enthusiast, DO NOT take this course.

reviews.author: Ronium
reviews.title: For amateurs who really love music
reviews.comment_content:
The content covers from some basic concept such as note, rhythm, interval, scales, chords. And finally, help you to do some analysis on the composition then compose a short piece of a final project. All these seem easy to handle if you have a strong foundation of music theory.
Some contents are more than so-called "music theory" but it is really cool to get access to basic composition skills and sight-singing.
Tutorial will concentrate on listening practice since there's a 30 point listening test in the final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: He's a graceful Finnish guy. I really like his improvised piano piece during the lecture. But it may be somewhat boring for those have a musical background.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got a B+ without such a lot previous knowledge about the music theory. That is, I really learn from the course, B+ is acceptable.

In fact, there are a lot of "professional guy" in this course, so it is hard for me to get a really high grade.

But still a B+ at least lol
reviews.comment_workload:
A little bit heavy.
Both Lecture and Tutorial take attendance.
Easy assignments can be finished within 30 mins.
A concert report which means you must watch a classical music performance in the flesh.
A final project, which requires you compose a 24 bars Major-Minor-Major piano piece using some basic techniques.

reviews.author: Kellycat
reviews.title: I got surprise
reviews.comment_content:
The content covers music theory below grade 8. I studied grade 5 theory around 8 years before and I forgot some content (eg i re-learn the chords, inversion, cadence in this course) I think the content in this course is not difficult to catch up actually. My friend who went to this course with me without music background could catch up too after asking for some clarifications from me (åˆå””å¯ä»¥è©±æˆ‘carry ä½¢å˜…._., æœ‰æ™‚hw äº’ç›¸check carelessness)
However for listening and distinguishing some fifth & seventh chords, we still found difficult after practising.. sad
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor teaches at a good pace that he gave some examples throughout his teaching. One lecture generally teaches one topic/ one complex subtopic.
In tutorials, it is good that the TA sometimes urges some students to answer in order to know whether u understand. There are some harder listening exercise as the semester goes on. In the beginning, you may be required to distinguish major/ minor, duple/triple, but at the end you need to dictate a short melody played by TA (played by instructor in final exam). There are some exercises uploaded to canvas which is caring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 25%
Well, some people think that it is funny/ ridiculous that the weighting of hw is so high that it exceed the midterm. Unfortunately, I didn't pay attention to some exercise and I didn't find that the hw contains more than one page (so i missed 50% or more), and I didn't pay attention to some questions (so i lost some marks again><)
I 'failed' around 3-4 exercise
So if you're considering this course, u better be careful in your hw:)

Final Exam 25%
distinguishing some fifth & seventh chords and melody dictation are included.. Luckily the instructor played many times for melody (that i saw many students felt annoyed and continue their exam and ignore the playing). Normally, you can finish and earn many marks here XD so if you are too afraid, you better not take this course

Concert report 15%
I guess the marking is not strict, you just need to express your feelings as you wish (å””æ´—åšä½œæ­»éƒ½è©±å€‹concert gd)
ä¸éæˆ‘è¦ºå¾—æˆ‘æœ‰å•²ä½å¯«å””å‡ºæ‡‰æœ‰å˜…concert report style._.

Midterm 20%
High mean actually
93/105 as i remembered
but it is easy (major/ minor, intervals, distinguish major/ minor& duple/triple& homophonic/polyphonic etc)

Attendance/participation 15%
YOU NEED TO GO TO LECTURES & TUTORIALS omg
of course you can bear your own loss (in marks) if you wanna skip
You see.. 15% (in the term I studied)

I 'failed' around 3-4 exercise + above mean in midterm + unknown marks in final (shd be not bad) + unknown marks in concert report = B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework every lesson but mostly don't take you much time
For me I had lectures every Mon and Wed, Mon gives hw then hand in on Wed. Hw given on wed then hand in on Mon.
(but i know generally no one loves hw every time-_-)

reviews.author: Alastoramin
reviews.comment_content: It is about basic western classical music theories, a bit harder than ABRSM Level 5 Theory Exam as identifying four sevenths cadences are required at final exam which is really difficult. Not recommend for those haven't taken any theory exams before if you hope for a good grade.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturer and tutor both teach well and they really can help you learn more and use the skills learnt in lectures and tutorials.

Lecture is mostly about theories and tutorial is mostly about composition skills and identifying melodies and cadences.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 25%
Final Exam 25%
Concert report 15%
Midterm 20%
Attendance/participation 15%

Mean Score for the midterm exam is 92/104, SD 16.5. Final unknown.  Not much A range is distributed.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very demanding. Full attendance is required for two 50 minutes lectures and a 50 minutes tutorial weekly. PRS is required for every lecture and it is impossible to let your friends help with the PRS as the tutor will find out who don't attend the lesson. And there will be at least one assignment needed to be submitted.
The concert report and a composition assignment will be submitted at the start of the final, which make your study period even harder. The concert report will only emphasise on the content, how you feel about the music performance but not the grammar.

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.comment_content:
HUMA 2104 is an introduction to the basics of music theory, with an emphasis on
reading, writing, and analytical listening. Writing skills taught in the course include pitch
notation using treble and bass clefs, rhythmic notation, the construction of scales in major
and minor keys, intervals, chords, chord progressions, and simple harmonic analysis.
Aural skills taught in the class and practiced in tutorials include recognizing chords and
intervals, notating simple melodies and rhythms by ear, and distinguishing between
tonalities (major and minor), meters (duple and triple), and textures (homophonic and
polyphonic). The course culminates in a final project of composing a simple tonal piece.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructor is interesting, for both lectures and tutorials.

Can't be late for class. Attendance is taken through PRS at the beginning of class sharply.

It is required to buy a textbook cause homework are attached at the back of the book. The book cost ~HKD$400. Be prepare for this when taking this course,
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 25%
Final Exam 25%
Concert report 15%
Midterm 20%
Attendance/participation 15%

Mean Score for midterm exam is approx. 90%. Final unknown.
reviews.comment_workload:
High workload. Nearly 1 assignment per lecture, but it is not difficult.

Students have to attend a concert and write a concert report like all other music courses in HKUST.

reviews.author: hkuspace
reviews.title: Good learning course but boring instructor
reviews.comment_content: The content is said to be intended for non-music background but obviously 99% have good music theory background. Student needed to buy a textbook which is either online with restricted time or buy a hard copy. Learning from note, pitch, scale, chords, inversions and cadences. Students with music background should feel very easy but non-music background students should feel depressed. A progress learning of how to compose a short melody will be taught.
reviews.comment_teaching: The textbook is good to read and easy to understand for even a new learner. But the instructor is too boring. Even all the lessons are compulsory but the lesson is not worthy to take. Do think twice if you wanna use a course and attendance to learn this.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is very competitive because so many students are having music background.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a bit heavy. Students need to take attendance in every lessons and tutorials at the start of the lesson. Students need to submit one to two pieces of homework each lesson. However, mid-term and final exam is very easy. Lastly student is needed to submit a simple composition melody.

reviews.author: michahaha
reviews.comment_content:
- Lecture materials are quite boring if you have any music theory background
- Prof. tries to make jokes but...
- Major/minor, chords, Rhythm, Listening...
- Chord listening and melody dictation part may be hard even if you have music background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Needa buy an expensive textbook (pdf format) and the license only last for one semester.
- Tutorials and Lectures (Both cant skip)
- Requires self-learning
- You must follow the 'rules' of the professor
- PRS once the lecture begins, never delay
reviews.comment_grading: - Grade is fair, still got B range when mt is 1SD below
reviews.comment_workload:
- Homeworks in every lecture
- Needa answer questions during lesson

reviews.author: i8u0
reviews.comment_content:
Basic music theory
The content will be easy if you have some knowledge in music.
Even if you don't, the textbook is well-written and very easy to understand. The final exam and midterm are almost the same as the assignments in the textbook, which are easy after reading the textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Classes are boring in my opinion.
The professor is very strict about attendances and participation. He only gives you 1 minute and 30 seconds for PRS from the time that class starts and after that you're counted as late. Although he dislikes students not focusing on class, he only mentions it and doesn't record it to grade students based on such attitude.
In tutorials the instructor asks some questions and students need to listen and sing as a group to review the contents. Tutorials are basically review of the lectures, but attendance is crucial.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since the content is relatively easy, it is quite hard to get a good grade with a decent score on the midterm, final exam and homework.
I personally think that the grading was a bit harsh on the concert report.
You have to attend every single lecture and tutorial in this course. Two tardies are equivalent to one absence. Attendance is taken using PRS.
I got a B+ as my final grade even with about 1 point deduction in each of the exam, but I know that my concert report was crappy and my assignments weren't perfect. I attended every class and tutorial.

Homework   25%  
Final Exam   25%
Concert report   15%
Midterm   20%
Attendance/participation 15%
reviews.comment_workload:
About one assignment a week.
The assignments are not difficult if you read the textbook and understand the content.
One assignment can take 1 to 3 hours.

One concert report (3-5 pages) that was due on the day of the final exam.

reviews.author: Jay
reviews.title: Heavy workload but worth it
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting for those who studied a bit of music before and wants to know more about how to compose a song. It is less useful in the first half of semester but easy to understand. It gets more useful but difficult in the second half of semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching in CYT, the instructor is nice but the way he taught is not really suitable for people with no music background. i.e. He usually demonstrates the rhythme and other tones on the piano and picks people to answer random questions. Even though the content before mid-term is easy, the melodies and content became harder to understand and hear after the mid-term.
reviews.comment_grading: If you finish all the things on time and attend all the classes, you can get an exellent grade easily. You are guaranteed to get a good result in exam if you attend all the lectures.
reviews.comment_workload:
Every week have two lectures, the first lecture of each week usually has one simple homework that needs to be handed in on the next lecture. Moreover, The content of the homework is pretty simple, usually is about the things he taught on lectures.
Every Student is required to attend a performance then submit a concert report with 4 or 5 pages. Writing the report is like doing the HUMA1000 essay.
Last thing is every student needs to compose a sheet of music in a A-B-A style, which the start and the end are the same. This composition will be done throughout the whole semester included in your homework.

P.S. All the tutorial and classes take attendence. (iPRS)

reviews.author: RachelBut
reviews.comment_content: The content was all about basic Grade 5 music theory which I have learnt before, so the content was easy to me.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was fun as the professor demonstrated examples by playing the piano and playing recordings to us quite often. The lessons were relaxing.
reviews.comment_grading: I have attended all lectures and only skipped one tutorial. Most of my assignments are above average. My mid-term was 102/104. I got an A for this course at the end. It was quite easy to get an A if you are a music enthusiasts.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was quite heavy. There were one assignment each week. You also have to attend a compulsory concert, write a concert report and do a composition at the end of the semester.

reviews.author: H_Barnes
reviews.comment_content:
All the basic theories from music notation, scales, intervals, chords to harmonies are covered throughout this course.
Attendance is required for every lecture and tutorial class.

This course is an advantage for those who have prior music theory knowledge and background. But it is challenging if you have no any music knowledge at all.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is good, in a sense that Kaila will explain the concepts in a very detailed and clear way and make sure you understand them. He sometimes will make fun/jokes in class so as to grab your attention.

I don't have a hard time catching up with the class because I have studied some basic music theory before. But it is still fine for everyone if you review the concepts after the class.
Also you will have to pay close attention to the instructor because he speaks quite fast.

Kaila is passionate talking and teaching students off the class. Overall his teaching is good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not very good. I still got B range but I have attended all lectures/tutorials with the assignments/exams above average.

Even a friend of mine also got a B but he has an excellent background in music.

The grading is based on below:
Attendance 20%
Midterm 20%
Concert Report 10%
Assignments 20%
Final 30%

The mean for midterm is high (93/104). The exams are easy if you have a good understanding in music theory. But it is more like a test of carefulness because you always have to check the answers before the submission of the papers. But I still cannot get a satisfactory grade.

Also attendance taken at the start of each class will affect the grades as well so it is a good practice to attend all of them.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite high. Assignment is given each week and it takes around 20 mins (depends) to complete. Carefulness is important for each assignment as well so it takes extra time checking the answers before submission. If you have an interest/background in music, these are not very hard and time-consuming.

A concert report is required as well, which takes me one day to finish it.

reviews.author: å‘€å®‰
reviews.title: Music Teory
reviews.comment_content:
The content is all about basic music theory , such as key signature , chords and so on . So , the course is suitable for those who have already study music theory.
attendance : every lecture and tutorial lessons
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of the instructor is quite interesting and clear . But for those people who have not studied any music theory beforehand , it would be relatively hard for them to understand what instructor taking about in the lesson . But if we are willing to spend more time to do revision at home , it would be fine .
reviews.comment_grading: The mean of the midterm is really high , 94/104 .
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is really high . Almost , we need to hand in assignment by person every week .
Moreover , we need to listen a music concert and writing a music concert report . I spend two days on finishing it .

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.comment_content: Content covers Theory exams Trinity grades 1 and 2. Basic music notation, Scales, Intervals, Rhythm, Mater, Harmony, Chords. Its not very hard for someone who has some prior knowledge. Course can be challenging if you have no idea about these terms whatsoever.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is pretty good. Very thorough will the material and super knowledgeable. Attendance is graded and has a fair weightage to the course grade so missing lectures and tutorials will affect your grade for sure.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is really strict. Im guessing they have narrow margins cs I completed a high % of all assignments with full attendance to tutorials and lectures but didn't get a satisfactory grade.  

Attendance- 20%
Midterm -20%
Concert Report- 10%
Assignments- 20%
Final-30%
reviews.comment_workload: Workload can be quite high. Assignments every lecture. Midterm and Final are quite easy if you understand it well or have prior knowledge.

reviews.author: yung
reviews.comment_content: basic music theory (less than Grade 8 level), including scales, chords, intervals, etc. Don't expect too much to learn if you have music background. On the contrary, you can learn a lot in a short period of time if you don't have any music background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor is excellent in music but he is strict. You can hardly chat or make a noise in lessons, perhaps he is too sensitive to sound.
Tutorials are NOT helpful at all but attendance are required.
reviews.comment_grading:
homework, tutorial 80% correct
essay mark unknown
midterm and final full mark
A-
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite extreme to those who have music background and for those who do not. 1 assignment per lesson. Memorizing all the notes is expected in first few lessons.
